Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel consisting of two joined sherds. The outside was well smoothed and shows remains of black and red ink, remains of two columnsof signs identifiable with red colour underneath the black one. Two modern lines in black indicate the joint on the inside. The sherd was part of an imported vessel, probably an amphora as it shows a cream slip on the outside and lots of lime in the break. On the inside remains of a whitish substance that might be traces of the original content.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
